byline.contributor: David E. Sanger contributed reporting from Washington, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.

abstract: North Korean state-run media declares test of intermediate-range ballistic missile success and quotes leader Kim Jong-un saying that country's missiles have capability of hitting United States forces based in Pacific; analysts say launch confirms disconcerting progress by North Korean missile program.

headline.print_headline: North Korea’s Successful Missile Test Shows Program’s Progress, Analysts Say
headline.main: North Korea’s Successful Missile Test Shows Program’s Progress, Analysts Say

snippet: The Musudan ballistic missile’s launch was a success, state media said, quoting Kim Jong-un as boasting that North Korea could strike United States forces in the Pacific.
lead_paragraph: The Musudan ballistic missile’s launch was a success, state media said, quoting Kim Jong-un as boasting that North Korea could strike United States forces in the Pacific.
